task.title: Write A Post
task.shortdesc: A post is a Markdown, HTML or other text-based file filled with site content. Posts are inserted into the layout by Jekyll when it creates the website.

context.p: Posts go into the _posts folder and can be a variety of file types. Markdown and HTML are the most common.

Jekyll can use a variety of file types, but the filename of a post must follow a specific format. This format indicates the date the post was made, and the topic of the post. The following format for the filename is required:

step.cmd: Create a file with a filename fitting the required format and of of an appropriate file type in the _posts folder.
Open the file in a text editor of your choice.
Create appropriate YAML Front Matter for the post. [I need to link to that task here, but I can't put a link here, and I'm confused.]
